inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure subscription contains IoT Hub
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription that contains IoT Hub

inputs.name: iothubname
inputs.label: IoT Hub name
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: deploymentid
inputs.label: IoT Edge Deployment ID
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices
inputs.helpMarkDown: Input the IoT Edge Deployment ID, if ID exists, it will be overridden. For more information: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment

inputs.name: priority
inputs.label: IoT Edge Deployment priority
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the priority to a positive integer to resolve deployment conflicts: when targeted by multiple deployments a device will use the one with highest priority or (in case of two deployments with the same priority) latest creation time. For more information: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment

inputs.name: deviceOption
inputs.label: Choose single/multiple device
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to deploy to single or multiple(by tags) devices
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: deviceId
inputs.label: IoT Edge device ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Input the IoT Edge device ID

inputs.name: targetcondition
inputs.label: IoT Edge device Target Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: Input the target condition of devices you would like to deploy. Do not use double quote. Example: tags.building=9 and tags.environment='test'. For more information: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment

inputs.name: moduleJsons
inputs.label: Module.json File
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build modules || action = Build and Push modules
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the modules(relative to solution root path) you would like to build. You can specify multiple files, each take one line. Reference for wildcard: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/tasks/file-matching-patterns?view=vsts

inputs.name: nugetFeed
inputs.label: NuGet Feed
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you have NuGet dependency for private package sources, choose/add a service endpoint

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: dockerHostEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Host Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker host connection. Defaults to the agent's host.

inputs.name: rootPath
inputs.label: Path of Edge solution root
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the root of Edge solution. Example: If your code repository is an Edge solution, then leave it to default value './'. If your solution is under subfolder 'edge', then set it to 'edge'
